did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Steinbeck - Ainsworth collection

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: A collection of materials relating to John Steinbeck, including letters manuscripts, photographs, books, and other materials.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Steinbeck - Ainsworth collection, M1501. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection features 65 letters and cards from John Steinbeck to his sister Beth Steinbeck Ainsworth during the 1950s and 1960s, and 10 additional letters written jointly to Ainsworth and another sister, Esther Steinbeck Rodgers. Additional correspondence includes letters from Elaine Steinbeck to Beth, and to Jean Groshong; several letters from John Steinbeck to "Uncle Joe" Hamilton; and other letters among members of the Steinbeck and Hamilton families. Manuscript material includes several short stories composed in the 1920s, and a galley proof of "East of Eden" with at least six minor corrections in John Steinbeck's hand. Other material includes legal documents, photographs, and scrapbook clippings. Individual letters have scope and content notes provided by members of the Wiltshire familiy, descendents of Elizabeth Steinbeck Ainsworth.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Steinbeck (John) Collection, 1902-1979 (M0263) Steinbeck (John). Steinbeck : A Life of Letters : production materials, 1975 (M0354) Steinbeck (John). Wells Fargo Steinbeck Collection, 1892-1981 (M1063)

did.unittitle: Correspondence
From Elizabeth Otis to Beth 5/24/1962

scopecontent.p: Returning El Gabilan and pictures; typed on McIntosh & Otis notepaper; ; location(s): NYC, M&O office

did.unittitle: From Elizabeth Otis to JS no date

scopecontent.p: Lots of news, then a P.S. - a Mr. Wallace arrived and they agreed on "$3000 a piece"; typed on McIntosh & Otis notepaper; location(s): NYC, M&O office

did.unittitle: From Beth to Family 1905, 1914
did.physdesc: 5 letters, booklet, hand pencil and ink, 23 total p.

scopecontent.p: Beth's letters home from Mills College with Esther; one letter to "Dear Chicken Pox" (John), one to "Brother"; with a 1905 piano recital booklet in which Esther is listed; location(s): Mills College

did.unittitle: From Beth to Bea and Stanford Steinbeck 2/6/1969

scopecontent.p: Talks of John going to Stockton and being with her during her husband's sickness and death; location(s): Pacific Grove

did.unittitle: From Beth to Elaine no date

scopecontent.p: After Beth's hip replacement; in response to John and Elaine's request for some addresses; she mentions that it's not easy to understand the Steinbecks; location(s): Pacific Grove(?)

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Bethie 2/1/1965

scopecontent.p: Elaine adds to Beth's coin collection from Ireland; desribes their trip, bad week; news of Harold Guinzberg dying (on previous trip to Dublin); Mary is gone; John got sick; location(s): Ireland(?)

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Bethie; John Steinbeck Memorial 1/31/1969; February 1970
did.physdesc: 2 letters, hand, felt pen (copy), 2 total p.

scopecontent.p: Elaine quotes Robert Louis Stevenson's poem, which Henry Fonda read at John's funeral; location(s): NYC

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Bethie; Mrs. Riggs 2/25/1975

scopecontent.p: Elaine's letter to Beth explaining "Pigasus" (original); second letter from Elaine to Mrs. Riggs with "ad astra per alia parci" (Latin), translated "to the stars on the wings of a pig", or "go as high as you can with the equipment you've got" (copy); location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Bethie - and Liz+Jim 7/24/1989

scopecontent.p: Clippings about Grapes of Wrath play in London; location(s): Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Bethie no date

scopecontent.p: Referring to enclosed Middle Eastern coins for Beth's collection; location(s): Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Beth no date

scopecontent.p: John's gall bladder attack (fall of the year of the attack); they're good, getting better; life together; location(s): NYC, 206 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Bethie no date

scopecontent.p: Note about some money John left for Beth, etc.; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Darling (Beth) no date

scopecontent.p: About spending a day together just prior; after John died; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Beth no date

scopecontent.p: After Gwyn died; the boys making overtures about writing a damning book about John, etc.; possibly 2.5 years after John's death; explaining she shares copies of royalties which have gone into 2nd copyright after John's death; the judgements; threats from the boys; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Dear Ones no date

scopecontent.p: Trip to Russia, Poland, Eastern European countries

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Jean/Bean-bag/Darlink 1969-1975
did.physdesc: postcard, 4 letters, hand, ink, 7 total p.

scopecontent.p: location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd/Sag Harbor

scopecontent.p: With envelope; location(s): Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Darling One (Jean) 1/6/1975

scopecontent.p: With envelope; reviews of Broadway revival of Of Mice and Men; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Liz 3/1/1994

scopecontent.p: Letter with cover of Parini proof; location(s): NYC

did.unittitle: From Elaine to Steinbeck House Guild(?) no date

scopecontent.p: Appears to be a speech to the Steinbeck House Guild (re: recipe book, John's love of California food); date unknown, but appears to be after 1975; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth and Gene 8/25/1937

scopecontent.p: Will not stay in Pennsylvania for rehearsals; location(s): Doylestown, PA

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 8/5/1951

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 10/16/1952

scopecontent.p: John working on speeches and Elaine is running "the talent pool" for election in November; location(s): NYC, 206 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 5/23/1957

scopecontent.p: location(s)Rome

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth no date (1959?)

scopecontent.p: location(s): Somerset

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth no date (1959?)
did.physdesc: letter, hand pencil and ink, 2 p.

scopecontent.p: Date sometime while in Somerset; discussion of recent illness; location(s): Somerset

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth no date (1959?)

scopecontent.p: Easter Sunday from Somerset; refers to Mary's illness; rain; US vs. England; location(s): Somerset

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth no date (1959?)

scopecontent.p: Boys with Beth while JS and Elaine are in the UK; lamenting about boys; sending guns to the safe; going home in October; selling house at 206 E 72nd for $90-$100K (bought for $50K) or rent for $600 or $700 per month; seems to be short of money; political references to Stevenson, Averrill, Harriman; location(s): England

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth Summer 1959

scopecontent.p: Boys' studies and time with Beth; location(s): NYC, 206 E 72nd(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 7/1/1959

scopecontent.p: location(s): Somerset

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 7/19/59(?)

scopecontent.p: location(s): Somerset

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth and Boys 7/20/1959

scopecontent.p: Boys' studies and American kids in general; location(s): Somerset

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 8/27/59(?)

scopecontent.p: Misc., including itinerary while in the UK; location(s): Somerset

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 3/18/1960

scopecontent.p: Thom received 1st prize State of Connecticut, 1st prize nationally; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From JS; Tom to Beth; JS 6/9/1960
did.physdesc: 2 letters, typed; hand, ink, 4 total p.

scopecontent.p: 3 typed pages from John to Beth, 1 in pen from Tom to John (no date); a year after the boys stayed with Beth; laments about Gwyn, the boys, money; mentions Jean's forthcoming baby; his plans to travel the USA in a truck any why; location(s): Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 6/22/1960

scopecontent.p: Truck to be delivered in a week; working on Winter of Our Discontent, first line from Richard III; concern for Esther; Holiday magazine buying 25K words of Travels; location(s): NYC or Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From JS to Bethie no date (1961?)

scopecontent.p: Just after Beth's hip operation; John is 59, has written 26 books; words came to him while awake at 3am...RELAX!

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 6/1/1961

scopecontent.p: Writes of sending special edition of Winter of Our Discontent to Beth, other copies to Mary and Esther; still working on Charley; going to Sag Harbor. NOTE - he says he means the words in the dedication "To Beth, my sister, whose light burns clear". (Has just turned down an honorary Doctorate of Fine Arts from the University of California.); location(s): NYC, 206 E 72nd(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 7/26/1961

scopecontent.p: To Beth in Fresno hospital; refers to Beth's hip surgery; location(s): Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 7/30/1961

scopecontent.p: To Beth who was in Fresno Community Hospital, general update; location(s): Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 12/7/1961

scopecontent.p: Traveling with the boys; concern for Esther at Carroll Rodgers' death; mentions Christmas at the Vatican, midnight mass seats for Pope and choir; location(s): Florence

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth no date (1962?)

scopecontent.p: Talks of speech for Nobel Prize; asking Beth to clean out his mess at 147 11th St. and mentions the safe ("in our garage")

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 2/1/1962
did.physdesc: letter, hand pencil and ink, 2 p.

scopecontent.p: Boys in northern Italy; Mary off on a tirp; Holiday magazine; location(s): Villa Panorama, Capri

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 2/17/1962

scopecontent.p: Mary on cruise to Europe; boys to join in a few days; speaks highly of Terrance McNally working with the boys; awaiting news of John Glenn's space trip; more ramblings; location(s): Capri

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 2/19/1962

scopecontent.p: location(s): Villa Panorama, Capri

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 8/9/1962
did.physdesc: letter, hand pencil and ink, 2 p.

scopecontent.p: Ramblings; location(s): NYC, 206 E 72nd(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth no date (Fall 1962?)

scopecontent.p: Late Nov./early Dec. before accepting the Nobel Prize in 1962; Natalia Lovejoy's address; London, then Sweden Dec. 7-18

did.unittitle: From JS to Esther and Beth no date (Christmas 1962?)

scopecontent.p: Last Christmas in this house; refers to new apartment; location(s): NYC, 206 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth and Esther 1/2/1963

scopecontent.p: Mary's cancer and going to Washington; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 1/31/1963

scopecontent.p: Talk of selling the house and moving into an apartment (condo); location(s): NYC, 206 E 72nd(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 3/16/1963

scopecontent.p: More on the problems with the boys, very detailed; location(s): NYC(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 5/16/1963

scopecontent.p: Death of Charley: John planted willow tree over him, Sag Harbor townspeople planted flowers all around it; dinner with Kennedys, sent copy of Red Pony to their children, Jackie sent a letter which was enclosed, asked to be returned; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth Fall 1963

scopecontent.p: Beth's hip problem; going to Washington, visiting desks in advance of Europe trip, leaving next Mon. or Tues.; seeing Ed Murror tomorrow (old friend); visiting Berlin Wall and Russia (news clip, 12/12/63)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth and Esther and Beth(?) 12/2/1963

scopecontent.p: Kennedy's death, but proceeding with trip; lots of rumors about his health - all untrue; Sag Harbor house robbed; location(s): Hotel Sacher, Vienna

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 1/20/1964

scopecontent.p: Letter meant for Esther and Mary also; full description of problems with Thom and John and then Gwyn; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 1/28/1964

scopecontent.p: Beth's typewriter; Gwyn, the boys; weather, etc.; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd(?)

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 2/25/1964

did.unittitle: From JS to All 3/23/1964

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 5/8/1964

did.unittitle: From JS to Mary and Esther and Beth 6/22/1964

scopecontent.p: Boys a bit settled; doing a lot for LBJ and wants to help him get re-elected; location(s): Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 10/9/1964

scopecontent.p: Pat Covici with cancer and ulcer; will ride in "Galway Hunt" at Christmas, Johhny Huston is co-master; losing weight; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth 10/10/1964

scopecontent.p: Concern for Mary's health; location(s): NYC, 190 E 72nd(?)

scopecontent.p: Possibly October, after Moscow; talks of the boys, Mrs. Shepherd (her letter enclosed); Mary coming; look for manuscripts which he gives away for tax purposes; location(s): Sag Harbor

did.unittitle: From JS to Read the card first (Beth?) no date

scopecontent.p: About John - he and a girlfriend took a motor scooter without permission, "she was badly bruised," JS fearing a felony charge; worried enough to put off trip to Pittsburgh to get a dog and a family dinner at the White House with President and Mrs. LBJ

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth no date

scopecontent.p: About Beth with new hip in Fresno; unpleasant story about John

did.unittitle: From JS to Beth no date

scopecontent.p: Joe is in DC; JS writes of his past writing, has lots of questions about his future; location(s): Los Gatos

scopecontent.p: Advising that his family started to California this morning (via Worcester, Albany, Buffalo, Chicago and Omaha); location(s): Leominster, MA

did.unittitle: Documents and Ephemera
